<|endoftext|>/*
You are given a vector of two strings, both strings consist of open
parentheses '(' or close parentheses ')' only.
Your job is to check if it is possible to concatenate the two strings in
some order, that the resulting string will be good.
A string S is considered to be good if and only if all parentheses in S
are balanced. For example: the string "(())()" is good, while the string
"())" is not.
Return "Yes" if there's a way to make a good string, and return "No" otherwise.

Examples:
catch_parens({"()(", ")"}) == "Yes"
catch_parens({")", ")"}) == "No"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string catch_parens(vector<string> lst){
    string str="";
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]=="("){
            str+=lst[i];
        }
        else if(lst[i]==")"){
            if(str.size()==0){
                str+=lst[i];
            }
            else{
                str+="(";
            }
        }
    }
    return str;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> extra_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long extra_factorial(int n){
    long long ans=1;
    for(int i=2;i<=n;i++){
        ans*=i;
    }
    return ans;
}

Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefix("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefix(string str){
    vector<string> prefix;
    string temp;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        if(str[i]==str[0]){
            prefix.push_back(str.substr(0,i));
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<prefix.length();i++){
        temp=prefix[i];
        for(int j=i+1;j<prefix.length();j++){
            if(prefix[j]==temp){
                prefix.erase(prefix.begin()+j);
            }
        }
    }
    return prefix;
}

/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_suffix("abc")
{"a", "b", "c"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_suffix(string str){
    vector<string> suffix;
    string temp;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        if(str[i]==str[str.length()-1]){
            suffix.push_back(str.substr(i+1,str.length()));
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<suffix.length();i++){
        temp=suffix[i];
        for(int j=i+1;j<suffix.length();j++){
            if(suffix[j]==temp){
                suffix.erase(suffix.begin()+j);
            }
        }
    }
    return suffix;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function which sorts the given vector of integers
in ascending order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several items with similar sum of their digits,
order them based on their index in original vector.

For example:
>>> holy_order_by_point({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> holy_order_by_point({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> holy_order_by_point(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res(nums.size());
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++){
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++){
        if(sum % 10 == 0){
            res[i] = nums[i];
            sum = 0;
        }
    }
    return res;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string concatenate(vector<string> strings){
    string result = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        result += strings[i];
    }
    return result;
}

    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */

    int i;

    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

    }

}

This function takes a vector l and returns a vector l' such that
l' is identical to l in the odd indicies, while its values at the even indicies are equal
to the values of the even indicies of l, but sorted.
>>> sort_even({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
>>> sort_even({5, 6, 3, 4})
{3, 6, 5, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<float> sort_even(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> l1;
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]%2==0){
            l1.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return l1;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given vector of input numbers, calculate Mean Absolute Deviation
around the mean of this dataset.
Mean Absolute Deviation is the average absolute difference between each
element and a centerpoint (mean in this case):
MAD = average | x - x_mean |
>>> entail_absolute_deviation({1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0})
1.0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
float entail_absolute_deviation(vector<float> numbers){
    float mean = 0;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
        mean += numbers[i];
    }
    float deviation = sum / numbers.size();
    float x_mean = mean / numbers.size();
    float x_diff = x_mean - mean;
    float x_abs_diff = abs(x_diff);
    float x_mean_abs_diff = x_diff * x_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq = x_mean_abs_diff * x_mean_abs_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real = x_mean_abs_diff_sq * x_mean_abs_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real = x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real * x_mean_abs_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real = x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real * x_mean_abs_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real = x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real * x_mean_abs_diff;
    float x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real = x_mean_abs_diff_sq_real * x_mean_abs_diff;

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>

float median(vector<float> l){
    float mid;
    float sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        sum+=l[i];
    }
    mid=(sum/l.size());
    return mid;
}
